scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder comprises several letters; telegrams; an invitation addressed to Mr. and Mrs. Charlton Morgan to attend the celebration of the Centenary of the Settlement of Lexington, Kentucky, on April 2, 1879; and a newspaper article describing the Centenary celebration. Most of the correspondence is addressed to Calvin "Cally" Cogswell Morgan of Lexington, Kentucky. R.W. Woolly wrote several letters to Morgan, some of which discuss a case regarding Henrietta Morgan's trust fund. Other letters discuss business dealings such as hemp sales, horses, and business transactions. A letter from Charlton Hunt Morgan informs his brother he has received an appointment as clerk of the Senate Committee on Transportation (May 7, 1879).
